properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 15 at 8:19PM EST until February 18 at 7:01PM EST by NWS Columbia SC
properties.description:
...River Flood Advisory Congaree River at Columbia...

.The Congaree River continues to be influenced by the recent
heavy rainfall across the Carolinas. The river level will
fluctuate over the next several days, but gradually recede.
Nuisance flooding will continue along the river over the next
several days. A series of weather systems will bring a chance
for more rainfall Sunday into much of next week.

The Flood Advisory continues for the Congaree River at Columbia.
* Through Tuesday.
* At 8 PM Saturday the stage was 12.0 feet.
* Advisory stage is 10 feet.
* Flood stage is 19 feet.
* Forecast...The river stage at Columbia will be 10 to 13.5 feet
through Tuesday.
* At 13 feet...Flooding occurs in flood prone areas near and
downstream from Columbia. Flooding also occurs over much of the
Cayce and West Columbia river walk.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Advisory means that nuisance flooding may occur nearest
the river when the level is below the official flood stage.
